excerpt: Vast Gothic structure with sculpture-filled cloisters, El Cid's tomb & daily Catholic services.
detail_description: Burgos Cathedral is a magnificent Gothic structure in Burgos, Spain, known for its rich history and stunning architecture. It played a significant role in introducing the Gothic style to the country during the Middle Ages. The cathedral features 38 altarpieces, numerous chapels, and intricate religious artwork. It also serves as the final resting place of El Cid, adding to its historical importance.
name: Burgos Cathedral
address: Pl. Sta. María, s/n, 09003 Burgos, Spain

excerpt: Modern anthropology museum with displays on human evolution & the nearby Atapuerca fossil site.
detail_description: The Museum of Human Evolution in Burgos is a fascinating paleontological museum showcasing remarkable human fossils discovered at the Atapuerca archaeological site. The museum features exhibitions on early human intelligence, Charles Darwin's work, and educational displays on the process of human evolution. Visitors can also take a shuttle bus from the museum to explore the Sierra de Atapuerca archaeological site, known for its caves, fossils, and stone tools.
name: Museum of Human Evolution
address: P.º Sierra de Atapuerca, S/N, 09002 Burgos, Spain

excerpt: Medieval gate restored in the 16th century fronted by carved figures & used for art & exhibitions.
detail_description: Arco de Santa María is a medieval gate that was restored in the 16th century and features intricate carved figures. It has been repurposed for art exhibitions and cultural events. The gate is one of the twelve entrances to the city from the Middle Ages, showcasing its historical significance.
name: Arco de Santa María
address: Pl. Rey San Fernando, 9, 09003 Burgos, Spain

detail_description: Casa del Cordón, also known as the Palace of the Constables of Castile, is a historic site in Burgos with significant ties to Christopher Columbus and Spain's Catholic monarchs. This 15th-century Gothic building overlooks Plaza de la Libertad and features a carved Franciscan cord at its main door, symbolizing royal occupancy.
name: Casa del Cordón - Palacio del Condestable de Castilla
address: Pl. de la Libertad, 12, 09004 Burgos, Spain

excerpt: Burgos, a provincial capital in Spain’s autonomous community of Castile and León, is marked by its intact medieval architecture. Its most recognizable landmark is the French Gothic Cathedral of St. Mary, whose 3 main doorways are flanked by ornamented bell towers. Inside is the Chapel of Condestable, decorated with figures of saints, and the tomb of El Cid (Rodrigo Díaz de Vivar), the 11th-century military commander.
detail_description: Burgos, a charming provincial capital in Spain's Castile and León region, is renowned for its well-preserved medieval architecture. The city's most iconic landmark is the Cathedral of St. Mary, an impressive French Gothic structure featuring ornate bell towers and the Chapel of Condestable, adorned with saintly figures and the tomb of El Cid.
name: Burgos

excerpt: Gothic 1400s palace-turned-monastery with ornate gold altarpiece & flamboyant marble mausoleum.
detail_description: The Cartuja de Miraflores in Burgos is a stunning Gothic palace-turned-monastery that dates back to the 1400s. Once a royal residence, it now stands as one of the most captivating monuments from the late European Gothic era. The monastery houses remarkable tombs of Isabel la Catolica's parents, crafted by Gil de Siloe, and features an ornate gold altarpiece brought from Christopher Columbus' second trip to the Americas.
name: Cartuja de Miraflores
address: Pje. Fuentes Blancas, Km 3.5, 09002 Burgos, Spain

detail_description: When visiting Burgos, Spain, make sure to include Mirador Del Castillo in your itinerary. This popular attraction offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city and its surroundings from the top of Burgos Hill. Located at Castillo de Burgos, a medieval castle with remaining walls dating back to 884 AD, this viewpoint provides an excellent vantage point for planning your exploration of the city. While at the castle, take time to appreciate its historical significance as a defensive structure.
name: Mirador Del Castillo

excerpt: Remains of a medieval castle featuring a network of tunnels & panoramas over Burgos & its cathedral.
detail_description: Castillo de Burgos is a medieval fortress in Burgos, Spain. It was built as a defensive structure in the year 884 by count Diego Porcelos and played an important role in the Reconquista, which was a historical process of Christian Kingdoms seeking to control the Muslim rule. Today, the ruins of the castle stand at 75m above the city and have been inhabited since prehistory.
name: Castillo de Burgos
address: Cerro de San Miguel, s/n, 09004 Burgos, Spain

detail_description: When visiting Burgos, a stroll through the iconic Plaza Mayor is an absolute must. This vibrant main square has a rich history, once bustling with market activity where locals traded food and textiles. Today, it remains lively, surrounded by colorful buildings that house various government offices and charming bars. The atmosphere here is electric, making it a favorite spot for hostel guests looking to unwind after a day of exploration. Nearby Calle Sombrereria offers delightful tapas bars and pubs for those seeking culinary adventures.
name: Plaza Mayor

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Burgos, the Paseo del Espolón is a delightful pedestrian promenade that beckons both locals and visitors alike. Shaded by majestic plane trees, this charming walkway stretches alongside the serene Rio Arlanzon, connecting iconic landmarks such as the Puente de Santa Maria and Puente de San Pablo. Just a stone's throw away from the stunning Burgos Cathedral, it offers an inviting atmosphere filled with cozy cafes and unique shops.
name: Paseo del Espolón

detail_description: The Statue of El Cid is a prominent landmark located on the Burgos riverfront, near the Puente de San Pablo. The statue depicts the equestrian figure of El Cid, a Castilian nobleman and soldier born in the nearby village of Vivar around 1040. Known for his military exploits, including briefly reclaiming Valencia from the Moors in 1094, El Cid is celebrated as a local hero.
name: Statue of El Cid

excerpt: Fine art & archaeological finds from the region, housed in a 16th-century palace with a cloister.
detail_description: The Museo de Burgos is housed in a 16th-century palace with a cloister and showcases a wide array of artifacts and art pieces related to the city's history. From prehistoric ceramic pieces and utensils to contemporary paintings by local artists, the museum offers a comprehensive journey through Burgos' past. Visitors can explore archaeological remains, sculptures, paintings, altarpieces, tombs, coins, and more.
name: Museo de Burgos

detail_description: Saint Nicolás of Bari church is a must-see in Burgos, offering visitors a unique experience to learn about the city's emblematic monuments. The church is located near the Castle of Burgos and provides stunning white stone carvings inside, making it stand out from other highly embellished churches in the area. Additionally, visitors can explore the small museum and sacristy at the back of the church as part of their entry fee.
name: Church of San Nicolás de Bari
address: C. de Fernán González, 09003 Burgos, Spain

excerpt: Lush riverfront recreation area with kids' play equipment, a stone bridge & picturesque archways.
detail_description: The Parque de la Isla is a great place for nature lovers and families. It has playgrounds, gardens, and a river with beautiful scenery.
name: Parque de La Isla
address: P.º de la Isla, S/N, 09003 Burgos, Spain

detail_description: San Esteban in Burgos offers a variety of attractions, including the Cathedral, Huelgas Monastery, Miraflores Carthusian Monastery, Evolution Museum, and Retablo Museums. The old city and ruins are also worth exploring. Nearby localities like Atapuerca and Castrojeriz are worth a visit if you have extra time. When it comes to dining, traditional restaurants like Meson La Cueva offer authentic Castilian cuisine.
name: San Esteban, Burgos

detail_description: The Museo del Libro Fadrique de Basilea is a captivating museum that delves into the history of written language from its earliest days. The museum features a collection of originals and high-quality replicas, including the renowned Voynich manuscript, produced by Siloe, a leading publishing house in the field. Visitors can explore the art and bibliography associated with these literary treasures. Additionally, there is an area dedicated to the Cid, adding another layer of historical significance to this literary haven.
name: Museo del Libro Fadrique de Basilea
address: Travesia del Mercado, 3, Bajo, 09003 Burgos, Spain

detail_description: The Centro de Arte Caja de Burgos CAB, also known as CAB, is a modern architectural gem nestled in the historic heart of Burgos. This contemporary art center, opened in 2003, offers a harmonious blend of modern design and historical surroundings. Situated near the iconic Church of San Esteban, visitors can enjoy stunning views of the cathedral from the terrace. The museum features multiple floors with diverse exhibitions including abstract art, photography, video installations, and showrooms.
name: Centro de Arte Caja de Burgos CAB

detail_description: Iglesia de San Lesmes Abad, located in the heart of Burgos, Spain, is a popular historical landmark dedicated to the city's patron saint. The church is known for its beautiful and ornate altars and houses the remains of San Lesmes. It's highly recommended to visit this charming church as it offers a glimpse into the city's rich cultural heritage. Adjacent to it is Paseo del Espolon, another must-visit spot in Burgos.
name: Iglesia de San Lesmes Abad
address: Pl. San Juan, s/n, 09004 Burgos, Spain

excerpt: Guided tours of 1187 Cistercian convent with its ornate cloisters, royal tombs & textile museum.
detail_description: The Huelgas Monastery, a Cistercian convent dating back to 1187, is a must-visit in Burgos. The monastery boasts ornate cloisters, royal tombs, and a textile museum. While exploring Burgos, visitors can also check out the Cathedral, the Miraflores Carthusian Monastery, the Evolution Museum, San Esteban Church, and the Retablo Museums.
name: The Huelgas Monastery

excerpt: Stately 15th-century palace offering a changing program of exhibitions & cultural events.
detail_description: Casa del Cordón is a stately 15th-century palace located in a charming square in Burgos. Built for the High Constable of Castile, it holds great historical significance as it was where the Catholic Monarchs welcomed Christopher Columbus upon his return from his second voyage to the Americas. Today, it houses a bank and serves as an exhibition space with a changing program of cultural events.
name: Casa del Cordón
address: Plaza de la Libertad Entrada por, C. de Santander, s/n, 09004 Burgos, Spain

detail_description: Plaza Mio Cid is a charming spot to wander, featuring a striking statue of the Spanish hero El Cid. From here, you can leisurely make your way to Puente de San Pablo and take in the picturesque views of the river and its verdant landscape.
name: Pl. Mío Cid

detail_description: Escalera Dorada, S.L. offers a delightful experience for visitors seeking both scenic views and local culinary delights. Guests can savor the rich flavors of traditional blood sausage while enjoying breathtaking landscapes that enhance the dining experience. Additionally, the establishment is known for its excellent selection of wines, making it a perfect spot to unwind and indulge in regional specialties.
name: Escalera Dorada, S.L.
address: Pl. Rey San Fernando, 9, 09003 Burgos, Spain

detail_description: The Chapel of the Condestable, also known as the Chapel of the Constables, is a magnificent funerary chapel located in the Burgos Cathedral. It boasts a centralized plan and was constructed in Flamboyant Gothic and Renaissance style. Situated in the cathedral's ambulatory, it is referred to as the Chapel of the Purification of the Virgin.
name: Capilla del Condestable
address: Cathedral of Burgos, C. Llana de Afuera, 19, 09003 Burgos, Spain

detail_description: Plaza del Mío Cid is a vibrant hub in Burgos, perfectly positioned at the start of the enchanting Paseo del Espolón. This picturesque promenade connects the plaza to the historic Arco de Santa María and leads visitors into the heart of the old quarter, where they can marvel at the stunning Cathedral. The square features an impressive statue of El Cid, a legendary figure in Burgos' history, alongside other notable statues representing his family.
name: Plaza del Mío Cid

excerpt: Abbey dating from the 10th century with medieval & Baroque-style buildings, a guesthouse & a museum.
detail_description: Nestled in the charming village of Santo Domingo de Silos in northern Spain, the Monasterio de Santo Domingo de Silos is an ancient abbey dating back to the 10th century. This Benedictine monastery, dedicated to Saint Dominic of Silos, boasts a blend of medieval and Baroque-style architecture. Visitors can explore its tranquil surroundings and historical significance while enjoying a guesthouse and museum on-site.
name: Monasterio de Santo Domingo de Silos
address: C. Santo Domingo, 1, 09610 Santo Domingo de Silos, Burgos, Spain

detail_description: The Museo Militar de Burgos is a captivating destination for history enthusiasts, showcasing an impressive array of military artifacts that narrate the rich military heritage of both Burgos and Spain. Visitors can explore a diverse collection featuring firearms, uniforms, flags, and historical memorabilia linked to notable figures from various conflicts. The museum also houses unique items like a bass drum used in military draws and a stadiometer for measuring soldiers' heights.
name: Museo Militar de Burgos
address: Pl. de Alonso Martínez, 3, 09003 Burgos, Spain

detail_description: Saint John's Monastery, situated in downtown Burgos, boasts a rich history and a unique architectural blend of Eastern and Western influences. The Islamic-style cloister in the courtyard adds to its allure. While now under municipal ownership, the monastery hosts various cultural activities and exhibitions, making it a popular spot for visitors.
name: Saint John's Monastery

detail_description: The Saint Mary bridge, which dates back to the 18th century, is a popular spot for tourists in Burgos. The wide walkway across the river allows pedestrians and cyclists to cross easily.
name: St. Mary's Bridge

detail_description: The Ermita Rupestre de San Miguel is an intriguing place, undoubtedly worth climbing the stairs to get a better glimpse of its interior. Unfortunately, the glass obstructing the entrance is excessively dirty, hindering clear visibility. Moreover, it is disappointing that some individuals choose to document the walls' inner side despite the broken door at the upper entrance. The chapel's historical significance and captivating aesthetic make it a cherished gem from times long gone.
name: Ermita rupestre de San Miguel

detail_description: "Crucero y Cimborrio" is a stunning architectural marvel located in the heart of a vibrant city. The structure boasts impressive design elements and intricate details that showcase the skill and craftsmanship of its creators. Visitors can admire the beauty of the building's exterior, characterized by its grandeur and historical significance. Inside, they can explore the rich history and cultural heritage that is preserved within its walls.
name: Crucero y Cimborrio

detail_description: The Marceliano Santa Maria Museum is a museum dedicated to the painter named Marceliano. It is full of paintings and furniture in excellent condition, and it is located inside the Monastery of San Juan.
name: Marceliano Santamaría Museum
address: Pl. San Juan, s/n, 09004 Burgos, Spain

name: Freedom Square
address: Pl. de la Libertad, 4, 09004 Burgos, Spain

detail_description: The Monastery Convento De Santa Clara is a beautiful and peaceful place to relax and getaway from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. The grounds are filled with gardens, fountains, and groves of trees, making it an idyllic spot to sit in the shade and take in the sights and sounds of the surrounding countryside.
name: Convento De Santa Clara

detail_description: Palace Capitanía- Military Museum may not be the biggest, but its intriguing exhibits and free admission make it a worthwhile visit. The collection includes toy soldiers, guns, grenades, and posters that are sure to captivate visitors of all ages. It's a great place for families with kids who will especially enjoy the displays.
name: Palacio de Capitanía
address: Pl. de Alonso Martínez, s/n, 09003 Burgos, Spain

detail_description: Arco de San Esteban is a well-preserved northern entrance to the late medieval city of Burgos, showcasing both military and commercial significance. The area surrounding it includes monasteries, convents, and neighborhoods that were once outside the walled enclosure. Visitors can admire Mudejar art in this defensive construction, which also offers a viewpoint accessed by stairs. Although parking nearby is available, it may be challenging to find a spot during peak times.
name: Arco de San Esteban
Monumento al Peregrino
address: Pl. Rey San Fernando, 1, 09003 Burgos, Spain

name: Estatua del Toro
address: Av. del Cid Campeador, 09003 Burgos, Spain

detail_description: The Estatua de Fernando I el Magno is a stone statue commemorating the reign of Ferdinand the Great, a significant king of Leon and Castile from 1037 to 1065. Renowned for his efforts in reuniting the Christian kingdoms of the Iberian Peninsula, he achieved a decisive victory over his brother Sancho III of Navarra at the Battle of Tamaron in 1037, solidifying his authority in northern Spain.
name: Estatua de Fernando I el Magno

detail_description: Estatua de la Castañera, located on Paseo del Espolon near the Arch of Santa Maria in Burgos, is a bronze statue created by local sculptor Bruno Cuevas in 2007. The statue depicts an older lady roasting chestnuts over a fire and reflects a traditional image that is gradually disappearing. Positioned close to the Santa Maria bridge, it's often overlooked by passersby despite its beauty and naturalness.
name: Estatua de la castañera

detail_description: The Estatua de la Evolución Humana is a captivating sculpture that artistically portrays the evolution of humans. It features an adult hominid holding a human child, symbolizing the transition in human evolution. Visitors find it worth stopping to admire from various angles and distances. The sculpture serves as a nod to the nearby Museum of Human Evolution, with two hominids depicted heading towards it. Many are drawn to take photos with this beautiful representation of past and future in our present.
name: Monumento de la Evolución Humana
Estatua de Doña Jimena
address: Puente de San Pablo, 09003 Burgos, Spain

detail_description: The Estatua de los Herreros is a beautiful and large bronze sculpture located at street level, depicting a blacksmith practicing his trade. It stands as a tribute to the fact that the street where it is situated was once known as Blacksmith Street. Today, this street is called C/ San Lorenzo due to the presence of a nearby church. The statue serves as a reminder of the area's historical connection to blacksmithing and adds character to the surroundings.
name: Blacksmith's Statue
Flora Fountain
address: Pl. Huerto del Rey, 13, 09003 Burgos, Spain

detail_description: The Muralla y puerta del patio del antiguo Palacio Arzobispal is a well-preserved section of the Archbishop's Palace courtyard wall in Arcos. The west-facing patio has been carefully maintained by its owners, and this particular part of the wall is a testament to their dedication. The gate with its arch, which was once the third entrance through the old wall, stands out as a notable feature worth mentioning.
name: Muralla y puerta del patio del antiguo Palacio Arzobispal
address: 09195 Arcos de la Llana, Burgos, Spain
